properties.Name: LifeInsurancePremiumSchedule
properties.Description:
The premiums payment schedule for the associated Life Insurance Policy.

As a policy matures, cash values grow accordingly.

The cash value of the policy is important and the policyowner may be entitled to received the accrued cash value in accordance with the term of the life insurance policy.

If the policy is lapsed or surrendered, the owner is entitled to the cash surrender value.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: SchedulePaymentDate
Columns.Description: The scheduled date of the policy premium.

Columns.Name: ActualPaymentDate
Columns.Description: The actual date of the policy premium.

Columns.Name: MortalityChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The cost of the insurance protection on a whole life product. On an illustration, mortality charges referred to as "current" are not guaranteed. Those stated as "maximum" are the contract guarantees. The mortality charge is similar to a one-year term rate and increases with the insured's attained age. For example, a typical $100,000 whole life policy for a 40-year-old male carries a premium of about $2,000 a year. Of that, roughly $350 is the mortality charge, and the rest of the premium goes toward the investment portion

Columns.Name: CashValueAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of cash value accumulated in the policy.

Columns.Name: BillingCycleId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Billing Cycle.

Properties.Description:
The premiums payment schedule for the associated Life Insurance Policy.

As a policy matures, cash values grow accordingly.

The cash value of the policy is important and the policyowner may be entitled to received the accrued cash value in accordance with the term of the life insurance policy.

If the policy is lapsed or surrendered, the owner is entitled to the cash surrender value.
